org.openimaj.audio.util

Class WesternScaleNote

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.openimaj.audio.util.WesternScaleNote

  • public class WesternScaleNote
extends Object
    Represents a note in a standard equal-tempered Western scale. There are various static methods for creating notes from names, note numbers, and frequencies.
    Author:
    David Dupplaw (dpd@ecs.soton.ac.uk)
    See Also:
    "http://www.musicdsp.org/showone.php?id=125"
    Created:
    27 Nov 2011

      static float tuningOfA

    • Field Detail

      • noteNumber

        public int noteNumber
        The MIDI note number of the note

      • noteName

        public String noteName
        The note name; e.g. C, D, F#, etc.

      • octaveNumber

        public int octaveNumber
        The octave number. Note C4 is middle C

      • frequency

        public float frequency
        The frequency of the note

      • tuningOfA

        public static float tuningOfA
        The standing tuning is A=440Hz. Can change that here.

      • twelfthRootOfTwo

        public static final double twelfthRootOfTwo
        The twelfth root of 2

      • nStepsBetween

        public static final int nStepsBetween(WesternScaleNote note1,
                                      WesternScaleNote note2)
        Returns the number of half-steps between the two given notes.
        Parameters:
        note1 - The first note of the interval
        note2 - The second note of the interval
        Returns:
        The number of half-steps between the two notes.

        Converts a MIDI note number to a frequency.

      • frequencyToNote

        public static final int frequencyToNote(float frequency)
        Converts a frequency to the nearest note number
        Parameters:
        frequency - The frequency
        Returns:
        The note number

      • createNote

        public static final WesternScaleNote createNote(String noteString)
        Given a note string, returns a new WesternScaleNote from which other information can be garnered. A note string is the note name followed by the octave; e.g. "D3" or "A#5".
        Parameters:
        noteString - The note string
        Returns:
        A WesternScaleNote or null if the note string is invalid

      • createNote

        public static final WesternScaleNote createNote(String noteName,
                                                int octaveNumber)
        Given a note name and octave, returns a WesternScaleNote from which other information can be garnered.
        Parameters:
        noteName - The name of the note
        octaveNumber - The octave of the note.
        Returns:
        A new WesternScaleNote

      • createNote

        public static final WesternScaleNote createNote(float frequency)
        Create a WesternScaleNote given a frequency. It does this by converting the frequency in to a MIDI note number and using createNote(int) which returns the note. For this reason, the value of the member frequency in the returned note may not be the same as the given frequency.
        Parameters:
        frequency - The frequency to convert to a note.
        Returns:
        A WesternScaleNote

      • createNote

        public static final WesternScaleNote createNote(int noteNumber)
        Given a note number, returns a WesternScaleNote from which other information can be garnered.
        Parameters:
        noteNumber - A note number
        Returns:
        A WesternScaleNote
